headline: GOP candidates in Ohio's U.S. Senate race spent $30 million of their own money in 2021
author: Haley BeMiller
sentences: It also has implications for the final months of the primary season: Crowded fields can narrow as candidates run out of money, but it's unclear whether those falling behind will drop out if they have the personal resources to keep going.

Five GOP candidates for U.S. Senate collectively spent nearly $30 million of their own money on campaigning last year, an unprecedented amount of self-funding for a primary contest that shows no signs of slowing down.

Haley BeMiller is a reporter for the USA TODAY Network Ohio Bureau, which serves the Columbus Dispatch, Cincinnati Enquirer, Akron Beacon Journal and 18 other affiliated news organizations across Ohio.

TV and radio ad spending alone has surpassed $23.9 million, according to Medium Buying, a Columbus-based ad buying and tracking company.

Self-funding by the millions
